lesson_01.Title: Our closest
lesson_01.Info: People colsest to us we call ...
lesson_01.Memo:
"Ovo je moja obitelj" = "This is my family"
"Ovo su moji prijatelji" = "These are my friends"

lesson_02.Title: Parents
lesson_02.Phrase: Majka i otac. Mama i tata.
lesson_02.Translation: Mother and father. Mom and dad.
lesson_02.Memo:
Small children would sometimes use the diminutive form, calling:
"Mamice! Tatice!" = "Mommy! Daddy!"

Teens would sometimes refer to their parents as:
"Stari i stara" = "Old man and old woman"

lesson_03.Title: Grandparents
lesson_03.Phrase:
Djed i baba. 
Pradjed i prababa.
lesson_03.Translation:
Grandfather and grandmother.
Great-grandfather and Great-grandmother.
lesson_03.Memo:
Kids usually call their grandparents:
"Deda i baka" = "Grandpa and granny"

lesson_04.Title: Siblings
lesson_04.Phrase: Brat i sestra. Braća i sestre.
lesson_04.Translation: Brother and sister. Brothers and sisters.
lesson_04.Memo:
Kids call their siblings:
"Braco i seka" = "Bro and sis"

We don't have the group name for siblings like in English language.

lesson_05.Title: Offsprings
lesson_05.Memo:
For both son and daughter we can say:
"Moje dijete" = "My child"

lesson_06.Title: Closer family
lesson_06.Info: When talking about closer family we refer to...
lesson_06.Memo:
"Roditelj" literally means "Birth giver".
Notice that "lj" at the end of the word is one complex letter in Croatian language. You can also find it in the next lesson for the word "friend" = "prijatelj"

lesson_07.Title: Friends
lesson_07.Memo:
We distinguish words for male and female friends.
For a girlfriend in romantic sense we use word "djevojka", meaning simply "girl".

lesson_08.Title: Acquaintances
lesson_08.Memo: The root of the word "poznanik" is the word "znati" that means "to know", therefore "poznanik" literally means "someone you know".

lesson_09.Title: Extended family
lesson_09.Phrase:
Ujak i ujna. 
Stric i strina. 
Tetak i tetka.
lesson_09.Info: Some members of extended family we call ...
lesson_09.Memo:
We have many words for the members of our extended family, as you can see in this example for uncle and aunt.
My "ujak" is my mother's brother, and "ujna" is his wife.
My "stric" is my father's brother, and "strina" is his wife.
My "tetka" is my father's sister, and "tetak" is her husband", and the same is for my mother's sister and her husband.
